commit_message:
Add packaging as an explicit dependency

We are using this package here:

https://github.com/openstack/kolla/blob/25f357ecc81bc2ad25a1e1b2f549d6a4b755b638/kolla/image/build.py#L114-L122

But we don't explicitly install it.

The requirements-check job forces us to pick a lower bound. Pick 22.0
which is the first release officially supporting Python 3.11 [1].

[1] https://github.com/pypa/packaging/releases/tag/22.0

Change-Id: I3b878204c3ccfd1dc32a8387884ec67cbc2469b7
Closes-Bug: #2067042

commit_message:
fix: patch bugs on cephfs operations

This puts the implementation a bit more in line with microceph's,
which delegates some checks to the ceph command.

Fixes a bug for `get_cephfs`, returning the true list of filesystems
instead of `None`.

commit_message:
Remove SQLAlchemy tips jobs

The most recent SQLAlchemy and Alembic versions are now in
upper-constraints. As a result, this job has served its purpose and can
be removed. For more information, see [1].

[1] https://lists.openstack.org/archives/list/openstack-discuss@lists.openstack.org/thread/RBHXHTO3GUOOXVSZXD4C2O3TKDOH2QSC/

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/879743
Change-Id: I6b84ecb57cc84601d8c8bfbc37ec2f9b54dca879

revisions:

Depending on the ceilometer and prometheus configuration, it
may be required to change the duration used by the prometheus
rate function in autoscaling queries. The prefered value
for stable testing should be <ceilometer_polling_interval> +
<prometheus_scrape_interval>. With other values (especially with
values less than the ceilometer polling interval), it's possible,
that the rate() function will just return 0 for ever.

Change-Id: Ifbb6da5c5be9db6cba5494b6d28b24d28967ec1c
"}]
commit_message:
Parametrize prometheus rate duration

Depending on the ceilometer and prometheus configuration, it
may be required to change the duration used by the prometheus
rate function in autoscaling queries. The prefered value
for stable testing should be <ceilometer_polling_interval> +
<prometheus_scrape_interval>. With other values (especially with
values less than the ceilometer polling interval), it's possible,
that the rate() function will just return 0 for ever.

Change-Id: Ifbb6da5c5be9db6cba5494b6d28b24d28967ec1c

commit_message:
Do not fail on missing logical router ports

set_gateway_mtu runs for all the gateway ports for a network
and if one of the ports get's deleted in meanwhile
whole transaction fails. Added if_exists=True so the
transaction do not fail for such deleted ports.

Also update minimal version of "ovsdbapp" required for
this.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ovsdbapp/+/919696
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/920062
Closes-Bug: #2065701
Related-Bug: #2060163
Change-Id: Ie0ce420414f1e6056d9df2733b7446d02c89fcfc

subject: Return both project_id when validating auto allocate network
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-05-27 08:19:23.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/auto_allocate/db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/auto_allocate/test_db.py'], 'message': "Return both project_id when validating auto allocate network

When neutron API is called to check requirements for the auto_allocate
topology, it needs to return not only 'tenant_id' field but also
'project_id' as that is required for the policy enforcement.
Without this 'project_id' field requirements check was failing for
member and reader users as they got 404 from the Neutron API. And the
reason why Neutron was returning 404 was that it wasn't passing policy
enforcement due to missing project_id field in the 'target' object.

Closes-bug: #2066369
Change-Id: Idf96a82bc6c8cb0b47dfde3baba94b42a8a8beba
(cherry picked from commit dfc01beab22f1c2b977d3e399c3fcda69a72082d)
"}]
commit_message:
Return both project_id when validating auto allocate network

When neutron API is called to check requirements for the auto_allocate
topology, it needs to return not only 'tenant_id' field but also
'project_id' as that is required for the policy enforcement.
Without this 'project_id' field requirements check was failing for
member and reader users as they got 404 from the Neutron API. And the
reason why Neutron was returning 404 was that it wasn't passing policy
enforcement due to missing project_id field in the 'target' object.

Closes-bug: #2066369
Change-Id: Idf96a82bc6c8cb0b47dfde3baba94b42a8a8beba
(cherry picked from commit dfc01beab22f1c2b977d3e399c3fcda69a72082d)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2024.1

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2024.1 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ibd448617d79a207c9139201244494d7c2846cc4f

Return both project_id when validating auto allocate network

When neutron API is called to check requirements for the auto_allocate
topology, it needs to return not only 'tenant_id' field but also
'project_id' as that is required for the policy enforcement.
Without this 'project_id' field requirements check was failing for

and install-dev.sh scripts fail with the following error:

subject: Complete server deletion before removing host from aggregate
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-05-27 15:29:51.000000000', 'files': ['blazar/plugins/oshosts/host_plugin.py', 'blazar/tests/plugins/oshosts/test_physical_host_plugin.py'], 'message': "Complete server deletion before removing host from aggregate

Unlike the instance reservation plugin, the host reservation plugin was
not waiting for server deletion to complete before removing the host
from the host aggregate. This was working fine until a recent Nova
change [1] started to prevent this behaviour:

    The host cannot be removed from the aggregate as the availability
    zone of the host would change from
    'blazar_c813e68a-1f6a-4ef7-a7b2-78434a7cb948' to 'None' but the host
    already has 1 instance(s). Changing the AZ of an existing instance
    is not supported by this action. Move the instances away from this
    host then try again. If you need to move the instances between AZs
    then you can use shelve_offload and unshelve to achieve this.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/821423

Change-Id: I1ae98d4f0e07e477e2ea9bf16b21b6561cebde10
Co-Authored-By: Matt Crees <mattc@stackhpc.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8f9dbeaf80cf8437094f94b1d0bdfaf58479a8b3)
"}]
commit_message:
Complete server deletion before removing host from aggregate

Unlike the instance reservation plugin, the host reservation plugin was
not waiting for server deletion to complete before removing the host
from the host aggregate. This was working fine until a recent Nova
change [1] started to prevent this behaviour:

    The host cannot be removed from the aggregate as the availability
    zone of the host would change from
    'blazar_c813e68a-1f6a-4ef7-a7b2-78434a7cb948' to 'None' but the host
    already has 1 instance(s). Changing the AZ of an existing instance
    is not supported by this action. Move the instances away from this
    host then try again. If you need to move the instances between AZs
    then you can use shelve_offload and unshelve to achieve this.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/821423

Change-Id: I1ae98d4f0e07e477e2ea9bf16b21b6561cebde10
Co-Authored-By: Matt Crees <mattc@stackhpc.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8f9dbeaf80cf8437094f94b1d0bdfaf58479a8b3)

subject: Backend: always operate on (class level) ovsdb_connection
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-05-22 18:11:48.000000000', 'files': ['ovsdbapp/backend/ovs_idl/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Backend: always operate on (class level) ovsdb_connection

Before the patch, the code was always attempting to rebuild indices and
start a connection, even if a connection was already started and cached
in .ovsdb_connection class attribute.

(Both operations were gracefully handled as no-ops. But they left some
confusing log messages about indices rebuild etc.)

Change-Id: Ib9ef29da251f5d184fa6abd20e1b17010f2ed1a1
(cherry picked from commit 33621ab1a8be0d5ce79776d992f4328f017a639f)
'}]
commit_message:
Backend: always operate on (class level) ovsdb_connection

Before the patch, the code was always attempting to rebuild indices and
start a connection, even if a connection was already started and cached
in .ovsdb_connection class attribute.

(Both operations were gracefully handled as no-ops. But they left some
confusing log messages about indices rebuild etc.)

Change-Id: Ib9ef29da251f5d184fa6abd20e1b17010f2ed1a1
(cherry picked from commit 33621ab1a8be0d5ce79776d992f4328f017a639f)

subject: Complete server deletion before removing host from aggregate
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2024-05-27 13:17:19.000000000', 'files': ['blazar/plugins/oshosts/host_plugin.py', 'blazar/tests/plugins/oshosts/test_physical_host_plugin.py'], 'message': "Complete server deletion before removing host from aggregate

Unlike the instance reservation plugin, the host reservation plugin was
not waiting for server deletion to complete before removing the host
from the host aggregate. This was working fine until a recent Nova
change [1] started to prevent this behaviour:

    The host cannot be removed from the aggregate as the availability
    zone of the host would change from
    'blazar_c813e68a-1f6a-4ef7-a7b2-78434a7cb948' to 'None' but the host
    already has 1 instance(s). Changing the AZ of an existing instance
    is not supported by this action. Move the instances away from this
    host then try again. If you need to move the instances between AZs
    then you can use shelve_offload and unshelve to achieve this.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/821423

Change-Id: I1ae98d4f0e07e477e2ea9bf16b21b6561cebde10
Co-Authored-By: Matt Crees <mattc@stackhpc.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Complete server deletion before removing host from aggregate

Unlike the instance reservation plugin, the host reservation plugin was
not waiting for server deletion to complete before removing the host
from the host aggregate. This was working fine until a recent Nova
change [1] started to prevent this behaviour:

    The host cannot be removed from the aggregate as the availability
    zone of the host would change from
    'blazar_c813e68a-1f6a-4ef7-a7b2-78434a7cb948' to 'None' but the host
    already has 1 instance(s). Changing the AZ of an existing instance
    is not supported by this action. Move the instances away from this
    host then try again. If you need to move the instances between AZs
    then you can use shelve_offload and unshelve to achieve this.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/821423

Change-Id: I1ae98d4f0e07e477e2ea9bf16b21b6561cebde10
Co-Authored-By: Matt Crees <mattc@stackhpc.com>

commit_message:
Add pre-commit configuration

'pre-commit' tool [1] provides an extensible way to configure hooks
which can be run automatically before each commit. That way we can make
sure that code send to review is passing base static analysis checks
like e.g. bandit, flake8 or hacking.

For now this is optional to use and not integrated in e.g. tox.ini file
but we can integrate it there too as next step.

To enable the hook install precommit and after install the hook in the
local repository:
$ pip install --user pre-commit
$ pre-commit install --allow-missing-config

[1] https://pre-commit.com/

Change-Id: I3c92c95e014f75fe6c3d4abaa243c2195f80e6f1

commit_message:
Make CentOS 9 jobs non-voting

CentOS 9 jobs are currently broken by the repository problem.

Error: Failed to download metadata for repo 'centos-nfv-openvswitch':
Cannot download repomd.xml: Cannot download repodata/repomd.xml: All
mirrors were tried

To unblock CI before the issue is resolved in mirror (or even in
upstream source), make these jobs temporally.

Change-Id: I09553b5c7759ca63c4a607aea010a19aa2e9d4bd

subject: fix connection.Connection finalizer
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2023-06-19 13:16:12.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/config/cloud_region.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/config/test_config.py', 'openstack/connection.py'], 'message': 'fix connection.Connection finalizer

finalizers execution order is not guaranteed in python3. This leads to
absence of builtins like "open" in the finalizers. Depending on the
keyring backend used inside of the set_auth_cache access to the file system
may be required.

Replace use of destructor to another builtin library "atexit" to
implement a more reliable exit handler.

Change-Id: I2d6882d64b57b65dbef086a08a3b3dc6b5faa2be
'}]
commit_message:
fix connection.Connection finalizer

finalizers execution order is not guaranteed in python3. This leads to
absence of builtins like "open" in the finalizers. Depending on the
keyring backend used inside of the set_auth_cache access to the file system
may be required.

Replace use of destructor to another builtin library "atexit" to
implement a more reliable exit handler.

Change-Id: I2d6882d64b57b65dbef086a08a3b3dc6b5faa2be

subject: Fix alembic migrations with SQLAlchemy 2.x
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2024-05-27 13:15:40.000000000', 'files': ['blazar/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/75a74e4539cb_update_lease_status.py', 'blazar/tests/db/migration/test_migrations.py'], 'message': "Fix alembic migrations with SQLAlchemy 2.x

Following the bump of SQLAlchemy to 2.x [1], Blazar devstack jobs
started to fail with the error:

    TypeError: Additional arguments should be named <dialectname>_<argument>, got 'autoload'

Replace autoload=True with autoload_with=engine as documented in the
SQLAlchemy 2.0 migration guide [2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/879743
[2] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/20/changelog/migration_20.html#implicit-and-connectionless-execution-bound-metadata-removed

Change-Id: I37f0e70e6ac1898e02546709b6ba197fdad313c0
"}]
commit_message:
Fix alembic migrations with SQLAlchemy 2.x

Following the bump of SQLAlchemy to 2.x [1], Blazar devstack jobs
started to fail with the error:

    TypeError: Additional arguments should be named <dialectname>_<argument>, got 'autoload'

Replace autoload=True with autoload_with=engine as documented in the
SQLAlchemy 2.0 migration guide [2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/879743
[2] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/20/changelog/migration_20.html#implicit-and-connectionless-execution-bound-metadata-removed

Change-Id: I37f0e70e6ac1898e02546709b6ba197fdad313c0

commit_message:
Backend: always operate on (class level) ovsdb_connection

Before the patch, the code was always attempting to rebuild indices and
start a connection, even if a connection was already started and cached
in .ovsdb_connection class attribute.

(Both operations were gracefully handled as no-ops. But they left some
confusing log messages about indices rebuild etc.)

commit_message:
CI: Use 2023.2 image for rabbitmq on ipv6 scenario

Currently RMQ 3.13 fails on ipv6 multinode scenario, use 3.12 from 2023.1
until [1] gets resolved.

[1]: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/issues/10728

Change-Id: If11710e99cf2e340e558d68e2071c1bb16825e55

commit_message:
Align horizon chart with 2024.1

- Update pymysql version info. Horizon requiers newer
  mysql client version than we had previously
- Update scripts to use sysconfig.get_path
  instead of distutils.sysconfig.get_python_lib which
  is deprecated

Story: 2011130
Depends-On: Ibd278f64b49c445dbbf774240a38c6c5ef3a4548
Change-Id: Ic763b72268042bda029c373d2b54c4c309fc70d2

subject: Implement variables to address oslo.messaging improvements
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2024-05-10 17:13:56.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml', 'templates/magnum.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Implement variables to address oslo.messaging improvements

During last release cycle oslo.messaging has landed [1] series of extremely
useful changes that are designed to implement modern messaging
techniques for rabbitmq quorum queues.

Since these changes are breaking and require queues being re-created,
it makes total sense to align these with migration to quorum queues by default.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22bug-2031497%22

Change-Id: I5dbb9a359872dbcff133b0003ab769df239d0e64
'}]
commit_message:
Implement variables to address oslo.messaging improvements

During last release cycle oslo.messaging has landed [1] series of extremely
useful changes that are designed to implement modern messaging
techniques for rabbitmq quorum queues.

Since these changes are breaking and require queues being re-created,
it makes total sense to align these with migration to quorum queues by default.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22bug-2031497%22

Change-Id: I5dbb9a359872dbcff133b0003ab769df239d0e64

subject: Add tag to enable targeting of post-install config elements only
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2024-05-20 17:02:24.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml'], 'message': "Add tag to enable targeting of post-install config elements only

<service>-config tags are quite broad and have a long execution
time. Where you only need to modify a service's '.conf' file and
similar it is useful to have a quicker method to do so.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/920058
Change-Id: Iae6fb286658fc924796a29fb08979cfe9113283b
"}]
commit_message:
Add tag to enable targeting of post-install config elements only

<service>-config tags are quite broad and have a long execution
time. Where you only need to modify a service's '.conf' file and
similar it is useful to have a quicker method to do so.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/920058
Change-Id: Iae6fb286658fc924796a29fb08979cfe9113283b

Drop unused --dev and --messy

These arguments are defined but are not at all used in any logic.

Ideally these should be deprecated, but this library is still in
pre-1.0 phase so I'd propose dropping these immediately.

Include openidc-*.conf in Apache.

This change adds a new configuration in line Apache's frontend
configuration to include (if present) the files generated by the
keystone-openidc charm to configure Open ID Connect configuration

Closes-Bug: #2064717

commit_message:
Add python3-packaging

Newer release(s) of Ceph require the python3-packaging deb package, and
it's not being declared as a dependency, so the charm needs to handle
this.

This change was merged in master in commit
a465929ecedd78fd37e81d35c2134ef053da5b88 although it can't be
cherry-picked since the change is part of a larger patch that shouldn't
be backported.

Change-Id: I8a92ee7604d3107fad7680dfd1b868f337346d5a
Closes-Bug: #2064717

commit_message:
Ignore InstanceNotFound exception when host rejoin cluster

Nova-compute would start failed if there are instances which were
evacuated and then deleted.

This patch ignores such exception.

Change-Id: Ibfe17ed800edd1631c580b47f6236a7229455b4f
Closes-Bug: #1897716
(cherry picked from commit fbf6178762ce6da733fbe5a05e482a351f0332c4)

commit_message:
Allow to skip volume type management by role

Right now it is not possible to avoid creation of a default volume type
which will have the same name as a backend. In case operator want to
rename volume type or have a different name - it will not be possible
as of today.

While we should migrate to using openstack_resources role for managing
of QoS and volume_types [1], the patch/modules are not ready and will
not be backportable anyway.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins/+/906372

Change-Id: Ic1e190fc86bd3b6fd2cc771273e28b5bb095a322
(cherry picked from commit ddddfde34d0cee46d2261eee638ab6589a1fd52c)

commit_message:
[unmaintained-only] exclude flaky migration test case

test_live_block_migration_with_attached_volume is failing very often
and makes gate somewhat blocked. This patch exclude this test case
to make the gate a bit more stable. This patch can be reverted as
soon as some better solution is found for this test case.

Change-Id: I92e7591ec55c7127b12bd1916148232997df074b

subject: Extend resource object
revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2023-08-17 15:02:50.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/exceptions.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/network/v2/test_flavor.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/test_resource.py', 'openstack/resource.py', 'doc/source/contributor/layout.rst', 'releasenotes/notes/extend-resource-c53f982e28ade7ae.yaml'], 'message': 'Extend resource object

Add additional configuration for the resource attributes in order to
make future code generation easier

- read_only - attribute is populated by the server and can not be
  modified
- required_on_create - attribute must be present in the resource
  creation request
- required_on_update - attribute must be present in the resource update
  request
- create_only - attribute can/not be updated after resource creation
- min_version/max_version - attribute requires certain min microversion
  to be used

Not all attributes are used in the code directly now. Some of them are
currently used by the codegenerator, while some will be used with later
changes (to enforce more validations during request processing).

Change-Id: I866af06a0b2860d29d45655d1fb60acea55d77c8
'}]
commit_message:
Extend resource object

Add additional configuration for the resource attributes in order to
make future code generation easier

- read_only - attribute is populated by the server and can not be
  modified
- required_on_create - attribute must be present in the resource
  creation request
- required_on_update - attribute must be present in the resource update
  request
- create_only - attribute can/not be updated after resource creation
- min_version/max_version - attribute requires certain min microversion
  to be used

Not all attributes are used in the code directly now. Some of them are
currently used by the codegenerator, while some will be used with later
changes (to enforce more validations during request processing).

Change-Id: I866af06a0b2860d29d45655d1fb60acea55d77c8

commit_message:
Align Resource._max_microversion attribute

In order to bring a bit more consistency into the attribute naming
before we do another version handling changes rename _max_microversion
into max_microversion and add min_microversion attribute on the Resource
class. For now min_microversion attribute is not used anywhere, but will
be used in the following changes.

A transition period approach (to support both _max_microversion and
max_microversion) has been tried, but since it is used in the class
methods it rerquires too big overhead to make any sense, therrefore all
occurences in the code are modified right now and old attribute is
dropped completely.

Change-Id: Ide3a5174a5cdbd0fbf40a62245ab6b670f5af732

subject: ironic: make conductor statefulset more configurable
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2024-05-22 20:02:26.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/templates/bin/_ironic-conductor-pxe-init.sh.tpl', 'ironic/templates/bin/_ironic-conductor-pxe.sh.tpl', 'ironic/templates/configmap-bin.yaml', 'releasenotes/notes/ironic.yaml', 'ironic/templates/bin/_ironic-conductor-http.sh.tpl', 'ironic/templates/statefulset-conductor.yaml', 'ironic/Chart.yaml', 'ironic/values.yaml', 'ironic/templates/bin/_ironic-conductor-http-init.sh.tpl'], 'message': 'ironic: make conductor statefulset more configurable

Made the conductor statefulset more configurable by allowing the user to
enable/disable the http or pxe containers and to modify their init
and/or runtime scripts. Allow another OS to potentially be used by
letting the user supply the HOST_OS value and FILEPATH. Simplify the code
by using the variables already defined. Include the snponly image as the
counterpart to undionly.

Change-Id: I181657bca6ace0f94f6e0ef0b6f8a5bc7a433ac3
'}]
commit_message:
ironic: make conductor statefulset more configurable

Made the conductor statefulset more configurable by allowing the user to
enable/disable the http or pxe containers and to modify their init
and/or runtime scripts. Allow another OS to potentially be used by
letting the user supply the HOST_OS value and FILEPATH. Simplify the code
by using the variables already defined. Include the snponly image as the
counterpart to undionly.

Change-Id: I181657bca6ace0f94f6e0ef0b6f8a5bc7a433ac3

subject: 3PAR: Error out if vol cannot be converted to base
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2024-01-31 00:15:05.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/hpe-3par-convert-to-base-vol-delete-snap-a460a4b1c419804a.yaml', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/hpe/test_hpe3par.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/hpe/hpe_3par_common.py'], 'message': "3PAR: Error out if vol cannot be converted to base

Consider volume and snapshots as below:

v1
|
`-- s1
    |
    `-- v2
        |
        `-- s2

User initiated deletion of snapshot s1.
It failed with some vague message.

Initially, it was suspected that ...
While copying volume v2 (sometimes an intermediate step to break
volume dependency), we send a request to clone the volume v2 to new
base volume; and the exception [1] isn't handled properly.

[1] Conflict (HTTP 409) 32 - volume has a child

However, on further investigation it was found that ...
after a new volume v2 (omv-<id>) is created and
when we try to delete old volume v2 (osv-<id>),
at this point the exception [1] is thrown as error.

This is now handled gracefully. Appropriate error is thrown
if the volume (v2) has snapshot (s2).

Co-Authored-By: raghavendrat <raghavendra-uddhav.tilay@hpe.com>
Closes-Bug: #1994521
Change-Id: I5e7fb425c92cdf8c16d5a86a58ca1a52421543d7
(cherry picked from commit dfd8f99743a29220ca3face5fdf00a1a6071cf48)
"}]
commit_message:
3PAR: Error out if vol cannot be converted to base

Consider volume and snapshots as below:

v1
|
`-- s1
    |
    `-- v2
        |
        `-- s2

User initiated deletion of snapshot s1.
It failed with some vague message.

Initially, it was suspected that ...
While copying volume v2 (sometimes an intermediate step to break
volume dependency), we send a request to clone the volume v2 to new
base volume; and the exception [1] isn't handled properly.

[1] Conflict (HTTP 409) 32 - volume has a child

However, on further investigation it was found that ...
after a new volume v2 (omv-<id>) is created and
when we try to delete old volume v2 (osv-<id>),
at this point the exception [1] is thrown as error.

This is now handled gracefully. Appropriate error is thrown
if the volume (v2) has snapshot (s2).

Co-Authored-By: raghavendrat <raghavendra-uddhav.tilay@hpe.com>
Closes-Bug: #1994521
Change-Id: I5e7fb425c92cdf8c16d5a86a58ca1a52421543d7
(cherry picked from commit dfd8f99743a29220ca3face5fdf00a1a6071cf48)

subject: HPE 3PAR: use vlan iscsi ips
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-05-20 08:48:16.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/hpe/hpe_3par_iscsi.py', 'releasenotes/notes/hpe-3par-use-vlan-iscsi-ips-f75787b0d281030b.yaml', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/hpe/test_hpe3par.py'], 'message': 'HPE 3PAR: use vlan iscsi ips

In the code hpe_3par_iscsi.py, only the trunk ips
(192.168.68.203) are considered. If vlan ips (192.168.100.1)
are specified, they aren't considered while forming list of
iscsi ips.

Sample output of "showport" command from HPE 3par storage system:

CSSOS-SSA04 cli% showport -iscsivlans
N:S:P VLAN IPAddr        Netmask
0:2:1  -  192.168.68.203 255.255.192.0
0:2:1 100 192.168.100.1  255.255.192.0
0:2:1 200 192.168.100.2  255.255.255.0

Kindly refer launchpad bug for details.

This patch adds support for using vlan iscsi ips.

Closes-Bug: #2015034
Change-Id: Idaea18411ae03c5a9696b2ab67e84087177fcc74
(cherry picked from commit 4482ec892f00a724fb2b2a56607d0815fe0c17e0)
'}]
commit_message:
HPE 3PAR: use vlan iscsi ips

In the code hpe_3par_iscsi.py, only the trunk ips
(192.168.68.203) are considered. If vlan ips (192.168.100.1)
are specified, they aren't considered while forming list of
iscsi ips.

Sample output of "showport" command from HPE 3par storage system:

CSSOS-SSA04 cli% showport -iscsivlans
N:S:P VLAN IPAddr        Netmask
0:2:1  -  192.168.68.203 255.255.192.0
0:2:1 100 192.168.100.1  255.255.192.0
0:2:1 200 192.168.100.2  255.255.255.0

Kindly refer launchpad bug for details.

This patch adds support for using vlan iscsi ips.

Closes-Bug: #2015034
Change-Id: Idaea18411ae03c5a9696b2ab67e84087177fcc74
(cherry picked from commit 4482ec892f00a724fb2b2a56607d0815fe0c17e0)

commit_message:
simple-init: Swap continue for true

Continue is not valid, and in the current syntax usage for 80-simple-init,
the error is logged. Swapped to true to act as a no-op.

/tmp/in_target.d/post-install.d/80-simple-init: line 30: continue: \
    only meaningful in a `for', `while', or `until' loop

Change-Id: I9ddb9aadc1114c0f4dea14d31b9751d83a887a6b

commit_message:
[Pure Storage] Add TCP transport type to NVMe driver

Add NVMe-TCP to the existing NVMe driver, which currently supports RoCE.
This change extends the parameter ``pure_nvme_transport`` to allow the
option ``tcp``.
Additional checks are performed on the backend to ensure that the
network ports used for connections are of the correct NVMe service
type.

Change-Id: I76166b9305f340a6e085216490d4c6bbecc7d1c1
(cherry picked from commit dc77207e4c73950f1cacee5c9022586821ea6b59)

subject: Applies nosec in Dell EMC eNAS
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2024-05-15 19:10:23.000000000', 'files': ['manila/share/drivers/dell_emc/common/enas/xml_api_parser.py'], 'message': 'Applies nosec in Dell EMC eNAS

Bandit raises a flag at evals, suggests using
literal_eval which does not work here.

Instead of using eval to parse the attributes,
should use getattr method instead.
When using getattr, unit tests fail
because of problems with mocking requests.
Applying nosec and reported a bug.

Related-Bug: 2065727
Change-Id: Ib5404d9e165be5879f5351c3f0952648ae702b2d
'}]
commit_message:
Applies nosec in Dell EMC eNAS

Bandit raises a flag at evals, suggests using
literal_eval which does not work here.

Instead of using eval to parse the attributes,
should use getattr method instead.
When using getattr, unit tests fail
because of problems with mocking requests.
Applying nosec and reported a bug.

Related-Bug: 2065727
Change-Id: Ib5404d9e165be5879f5351c3f0952648ae702b2d

commit_message:
Remove ansible-runner

ansible-runner was added to be used by networking-ansible[1]. However
the project hasn't get any update for 3 years and looks unmaintained.

[1] a449abac5d3336db765006d8cc6829fd4785dccb

Remove ansible-runner from global-requirements to avoid maintaining
dependencies for unmaintained projects. This allows us to get rid of
lockfile which was already retired[2].

[2] 45d30134d218f661346326da7fa0f19cb3de97f9

Change-Id: I1304f2dfcd6c9b0ab3a3ec54f50238705179d1f5

subject: docs: Add more information about unified limits
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2024-05-17 19:26:09.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/admin/unified-limits.rst', 'doc/source/user/unified-limits.rst'], 'message': "docs: Add more information about unified limits

The admin docs are missing some details about enabling unified limits,
like oslo.limit configuration and Keystone roles. This adds more
information about what roles are needed for what actions, how to set
quota limits, quota enforcement, and unified limits in general.

This also removes a couple of tables from the user docs that show
obsolete/deprecated quota limits because they may be more confusing
than helpful considering we don't want new deployments to use them and
they add more clutter to the page.

More info is also added regarding the CLI commands for unified limits
and makes it consistent between the user and admin docs.

Change-Id: Id93f9997d1b217e0c2151c88323564f7a7fefc02
"}]
commit_message:
docs: Add more information about unified limits

The admin docs are missing some details about enabling unified limits,
like oslo.limit configuration and Keystone roles. This adds more
information about what roles are needed for what actions, how to set
quota limits, quota enforcement, and unified limits in general.

This also removes a couple of tables from the user docs that show
obsolete/deprecated quota limits because they may be more confusing
than helpful considering we don't want new deployments to use them and
they add more clutter to the page.

More info is also added regarding the CLI commands for unified limits
and makes it consistent between the user and admin docs.

Change-Id: Id93f9997d1b217e0c2151c88323564f7a7fefc02

subject: Allow to skip volume type management by role
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-05-20 16:44:52.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/allow_to_skip_volume_types-8698ec60660a0510.yaml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Allow to skip volume type management by role

Right now it is not possible to avoid creation of a default volume type
which will have the same name as a backend. In case operator want to
rename volume type or have a different name - it will not be possible
as of today.

While we should migrate to using openstack_resources role for managing
of QoS and volume_types [1], the patch/modules are not ready and will
not be backportable anyway.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins/+/906372

Change-Id: Ic1e190fc86bd3b6fd2cc771273e28b5bb095a322
(cherry picked from commit ddddfde34d0cee46d2261eee638ab6589a1fd52c)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow to skip volume type management by role

Right now it is not possible to avoid creation of a default volume type
which will have the same name as a backend. In case operator want to
rename volume type or have a different name - it will not be possible
as of today.

While we should migrate to using openstack_resources role for managing
of QoS and volume_types [1], the patch/modules are not ready and will
not be backportable anyway.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins/+/906372

Change-Id: Ic1e190fc86bd3b6fd2cc771273e28b5bb095a322
(cherry picked from commit ddddfde34d0cee46d2261eee638ab6589a1fd52c)

commit_message:
Stable changes for stable/2024.1 (caracal) branch

This patch converts stable/2024.1 into a stable maintenance branch. It:

- modifies .gitreview to point to stable/2024.1
- switches (test-)requirements*.txt -> (test-)requirements*.in
  for pip-compile usage.
- creates (test-)requirements-py*.txt from *.in using pip-compile for
  the relevant python version.
- Updates bundles to point to ceph/edge and 24.04/edge for ceph and
  OVN charms.
- Adds build.lock file to the reactive charms.
- Syncs charm-helpers for classic charms.
- Locks requirements.txt from requirements.in for ops machine charms.
- Locks charms.openstack, zaza, zaza-openstack-tests, charm-helpers to
  stable branches.

Change-Id: I58c7486eb1262ad142da6c23f13fb072d652d723

commit_message:
Stable changes for stable/2024.1 (caracal) branch

This patch converts stable/2024.1 into a stable maintenance branch. It:

- modifies .gitreview to point to stable/2024.1
- switches (test-)requirements*.txt -> (test-)requirements*.in
  for pip-compile usage.
- creates (test-)requirements-py*.txt from *.in using pip-compile for
  the relevant python version.
- Updates bundles to point to ceph/edge and 24.04/edge for ceph and
  OVN charms.
- Adds build.lock file to the reactive charms.
- Syncs charm-helpers for classic charms.
- Locks requirements.txt from requirements.in for ops machine charms.
- Locks charms.openstack, zaza, zaza-openstack-tests, charm-helpers to
  stable branches.

Change-Id: Id84f55f1231cf098c4567aaa0f1f7d27930924a9

commit_message:
Stable changes for stable/2024.1 (caracal) branch

This patch converts stable/2024.1 into a stable maintenance branch. It:

- modifies .gitreview to point to stable/2024.1
- switches (test-)requirements*.txt -> (test-)requirements*.in
  for pip-compile usage.
- creates (test-)requirements-py*.txt from *.in using pip-compile for
  the relevant python version.
- Updates bundles to point to ceph/edge and 24.04/edge for ceph and
  OVN charms.
- Adds build.lock file to the reactive charms.
- Syncs charm-helpers for classic charms.
- Locks requirements.txt from requirements.in for ops machine charms.
- Locks charms.openstack, zaza, zaza-openstack-tests, charm-helpers to
  stable branches.

- disable py311 test as it's proving extremely difficult to mock out
  get_platform()

Change-Id: I68760b90d1cfa4da8dd3f1171518561e2c2b93d3

commit_message:
scheduler: AggregateMultitenancyIsolation to support unlimited tenant

This commit removes the previous limitation on the number of tenants
that can be filtered using the `filter_tenant_id` aggregate property
in the AggregateMultitenancyIsolation scheduler filter.

The `filter_tenant_id` can now be used as a suffix, allowing for an
unlimited number of tenant ID properties to be set on the
aggregate. This update maintains backward compatibility.

Implements: blueprint aggregatemultitenancyisolation-to-support-unlimited-tenant
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@industrialdiscipline.com>
Change-Id: Ic87d142647774b62a6af2cc5eb7a3cd66f9afeb7

subject: Support same pkg version for multiple releases
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-05-22 13:59:37.000000000', 'files': ['charms_openstack/charm/core.py', 'unit_tests/charms_openstack/charm/test_core.py'], 'message': 'Support same pkg version for multiple releases

It is possible for the version of a package to remain the same
across multiple releases of openstack so this adds support to
get_os_codename_package() to allow this.

If releases A, B and C have version N and we are on release B
this will return release C so that it does not look like there
is an upgrade necessary. The main change here that allows this
is to support matching major and minor version up to X.Y.Z as
opposed to previously only matching the major version X.

Related-Bug: #1973303

Change-Id: I138f61312efb728544276483b1a459b9eeecafdb
(cherry picked from commit 55f98e80e430b1112c38b90d88e10bd0923daa6f)
'}]
commit_message:
Support same pkg version for multiple releases

It is possible for the version of a package to remain the same
across multiple releases of openstack so this adds support to
get_os_codename_package() to allow this.

If releases A, B and C have version N and we are on release B
this will return release C so that it does not look like there
is an upgrade necessary. The main change here that allows this
is to support matching major and minor version up to X.Y.Z as
opposed to previously only matching the major version X.

Related-Bug: #1973303

Change-Id: I138f61312efb728544276483b1a459b9eeecafdb
(cherry picked from commit 55f98e80e430b1112c38b90d88e10bd0923daa6f)

commit_message:
Implement key rotation on Reef

This patchset implements key rotation for the ceph-fs charm by
receiving the new pending key from the ceph-mon charm and
manually rotating it via Ceph's authtool. It makes use of the
'ceph-mds-relation-changed' hook for this.

Change-Id: I499b3062d8443884fad03c881aac90c88c851ecd

subject: Set GLANCE_SERVICE_HOST but not GLANCE_HOSTPORT in localrc
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-09 04:09:21.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': 'Set GLANCE_SERVICE_HOST but not GLANCE_HOSTPORT in localrc

To support WSGI deployment in Pike is community wide
goal, after then service will be accessed like
https://host/service, but not https://host:port/.
The specific port number is set in devstack-vm-gate.sh
for Glance service using GLANCE_HOSTPORT:

  localrc_set "$localrc_file" "GLANCE_HOSTPORT" "$primary_node:9292"

Just set GLANCE_SERVICE_HOST will be good enough, and make
devstack_vm_gate.sh being ready for WSGI deployment:

  localrc_set "$localrc_file" "GLANCE_SERVICE_HOST" "$primary_node"

Because GLANCE_HOSTPORT is defined:

  GLANCE_HOSTPORT=${GLANCE_HOSTPORT:-$GLANCE_SERVICE_HOST:$GLANCE_SERVICE_PORT}

Change-Id: If59ad3f020f0eb1bdcc8a5e21b92ca00bcb085c6
Signed-off-by: joehuang <joehuang@huawei.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Set GLANCE_SERVICE_HOST but not GLANCE_HOSTPORT in localrc

To support WSGI deployment in Pike is community wide
goal, after then service will be accessed like
https://host/service, but not https://host:port/.
The specific port number is set in devstack-vm-gate.sh
for Glance service using GLANCE_HOSTPORT:

  localrc_set "$localrc_file" "GLANCE_HOSTPORT" "$primary_node:9292"

Just set GLANCE_SERVICE_HOST will be good enough, and make
devstack_vm_gate.sh being ready for WSGI deployment:

  localrc_set "$localrc_file" "GLANCE_SERVICE_HOST" "$primary_node"

Because GLANCE_HOSTPORT is defined:

  GLANCE_HOSTPORT=${GLANCE_HOSTPORT:-$GLANCE_SERVICE_HOST:$GLANCE_SERVICE_PORT}

Change-Id: If59ad3f020f0eb1bdcc8a5e21b92ca00bcb085c6
Signed-off-by: joehuang <joehuang@huawei.com>

commit_message:
WIP Sync to disk less

Testing what effect, if any, making some settings to affect disk write
behavior have on the gate. If we get lucky, this will make jobs faster.
If we get unlucky, it will break everything.

Change-Id: Ieb334a907643db2653b8a7d98d1028d9d813c07d

subject: reproduce.sh: Fix the dump of devstack-gate hooks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-21 13:58:45.000000000', 'files': ['functions.sh'], 'message': 'reproduce.sh: Fix the dump of devstack-gate hooks

The current coding is just yielding "not found" messages.

    bash-3.2$ function hoge {
    > echo "hi"
    > }
    bash-3.2$ hoge
    hi
    bash-3.2$ declare -fp hoge
    bash: declare: hoge: not found
    bash-3.2$ declare -f hoge

commit_message:
reproduce.sh: Fix the dump of devstack-gate hooks

The current coding is just yielding "not found" messages.

    bash-3.2$ function hoge {
    > echo "hi"
    > }
    bash-3.2$ hoge
    hi
    bash-3.2$ declare -fp hoge
    bash: declare: hoge: not found
    bash-3.2$ declare -f hoge
    hoge ()
    {
        echo "hi"
    }
    bash-3.2$

Story: 2001076
Task: 4723

commit_message:
Set cinder image cache limits

We used to just let it go to unlimited, but we should
actually test with limits for better coverage with
cinder code and to better mimic a "real" deployment.

Most users would not have an unlimited cache size.

Change-Id: I62b279e0d7ed56c111e5a745965172d52764d442
Partial-Bug: #1701696
Depends-On: Ia6d43b35843682bd201e57bb2941ca0243606412

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-07-26 01:33:39.000000000', 'files': ['functions.sh'], 'message': "Only grab journal data since log-start-timestamp

otherwise we might waste time and space to save old journal data
from previous devstack runs if journal logs have not been cleaned

Change-Id: Id10c7bc2412e57eac6dd064d204b4f936300ab9d
Closes-Bug: #1704044
"}]
commit_message:
Only grab journal data since log-start-timestamp

We should only save journal data since 'log-start-timestamp.txt'
otherwise we might waste time and space to save old journal data
from previous devstack runs if journal logs have not been cleaned
before current devstack.

Change-Id: Id10c7bc2412e57eac6dd064d204b4f936300ab9d
Closes-Bug: #1704044

subject: Create aligned partitions in disk fixing
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-09-02 19:03:01.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/fix_disk_layout/tasks/main.yaml'], 'message': 'Create aligned partitions in disk fixing

When we create a partition for swap and /opt make sure those partitions
are optimally aligned for the disk in use. This removes a warning and
potentially provides better throughput.

Note that we seem to have to do all of this maths ourselves
unfortunately. Basically we want partitions to begin and end on
sector multiples of (optimized_io_size / physical_block_size) offset by
the prescribed offset size.

Change-Id: I7f0d10193d6d654644010d64301ca8f904dc87f1
'}]
commit_message:
Create aligned partitions in disk fixing

When we create a partition for swap and /opt make sure those partitions
are optimally aligned for the disk in use. This removes a warning and
potentially provides better throughput.

Note that we seem to have to do all of this maths ourselves
unfortunately. Basically we want partitions to begin and end on
sector multiples of (optimized_io_size / physical_block_size) offset by
the prescribed offset size.

Change-Id: I7f0d10193d6d654644010d64301ca8f904dc87f1

commit_message:
Make ETCD_DOWNLOAD_URL configurable

The download url for etcd was hardcoded to tarballs.openstack.org.
But third party CIs might want to point to a different location.
Therefore making the ETCD_DOWNLOAD_URL variable configureable.

Change-Id: If466cc3b28d33ad09313598bb2315444e617abbf

commit_message:
Use new tempest run workflow

This commit changes to use a new tempest run workflow which uses
a workspace not through tox command. Generally, we think tempest users
use a workspace explicitly. Actually, using tox also uses a workspace.
However, it is implicit. So, this is a straight way to ensure the new
tempest run workflow.

Change-Id: I11bd08942d4690454b5f0eff3b5ca184c774e0f9
Depends-On: Ida35a27fc441847351084be033e35e9a04042195

[{'number': 30, 'created': '2017-03-16 10:15:20.000000000', 'files': ['features.yaml', 'devstack-vm-gate.sh', 'test-matrix.py'], 'message': 'Add MULTI_KEYSTONE flag and new role

Add 'subnode_keystone' role to feature matrix.
This role would be useful for Keystone multinode grenade job as we need
multi-Keystone openstack installation. We need to have a controller and
one Keystone node which only has a Keystone service running.

Environment variable MULTI_KEYSTONE is responsible for activating this role.

Set "RECREATE_KEYSTONE_DB=False" to subnode localrc in case of MULTI_KEYSTONE
is set to 1.

Partially-Implements: bp rolling-upgrade-testing

Change-Id: I577eb46b82bef54f89eed5c8a43a472341ff17a6
'}]
commit_message:
Add MULTI_KEYSTONE flag and new role

Add 'subnode_keystone' role to feature matrix.
This role would be useful for Keystone multinode grenade job as we need
multi-Keystone openstack installation. We need to have a controller and
one Keystone node which only has a Keystone service running.

Environment variable MULTI_KEYSTONE is responsible for activating this role.

Set "RECREATE_KEYSTONE_DB=False" to subnode localrc in case of MULTI_KEYSTONE
is set to 1.

Partially-Implements: bp rolling-upgrade-testing

Change-Id: I577eb46b82bef54f89eed5c8a43a472341ff17a6

commit_message:
Add commands listed in DEVSTACK_GATE_ADD_TEMPEST_SUDO to tempest sudoers

This makes it possible to add sudo permission for commands listed
by DEVSTACK_GATE_ADD_TEMPEST_SUDO environment variables.
The command list should be specified by a comma separator.
For example it will be like the following:
  DEVSTACK_GATE_ADD_TEMPEST_SUDO="/usr/bin/ovs-vsctl,/usr/bin/docker"

Change-Id: I15eddbe468dd43f3b90d1474c4eb27f2ab9e98c3

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-07 00:08:47.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': "Reintroduce testr slowest after tempest run

This commit reintroduces the testr slowest call after the tempest run to
print the slowest tests from the job. This was recently reverted in
change Ibde5417d005265d27e939ca29788c21f73b38980 because of an issue
when running tempest with system site packages enabled where the testr
binary wasn't in the venv. This is because the testrepository python
package is always system installed, and it's how we collect subunit data
from all runs in the cleanup functions. So now instead of assuming it's
present in a tox venv from tempest, it just calls the system version.

Change-Id: I5d07b49c5b428b1c92d990e7cc822a3483d39689
"}]
commit_message:
Reintroduce testr slowest after tempest run

This commit reintroduces the testr slowest call after the tempest run to
print the slowest tests from the job. This was recently reverted in
change Ibde5417d005265d27e939ca29788c21f73b38980 because of an issue
when running tempest with system site packages enabled where the testr
binary wasn't in the venv. This is because the testrepository python
package is always system installed, and it's how we collect subunit data
from all runs in the cleanup functions. So now instead of assuming it's
present in a tox venv from tempest, it just calls the system version.

Change-Id: I5d07b49c5b428b1c92d990e7cc822a3483d39689

commit_message:
Enable Swift multinode grenade testing

As Swift is aiming to add multinode grenade rolling upgrade test. The
goal here is to disable specific services on primary
and/or subnode and test compatibility.

This introduces a new features.yaml element that would
disable s-proxy on primary node. This will be required for Swift
multinode grenade jobs that will test compatibility
of master s-account, s-container, s-object
with stable s-proxy.

Also in devstack-gate-vm.sh the storage node needs to be
identified for configuration.  In this case that node is
the primary node.

Change-Id: I4681518b0142da1d43c1d090e30a3e7ec696d2b9

subject: Move location of devstack-gate unstack to post-tempest
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2018-10-30 10:36:50.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh', 'playbooks/setup_for_unstack.yaml'], 'message': 'Move location of devstack-gate unstack to post-tempest

Setting DEVSTACK_GATE_UNSTACK currently will cause devstack-gate to
unstack devstack prior to running tempest. This patch moves that logic
into a EXIT trap to ensure it always runs after everything else is done.
So that it works for environments where they need to stack, run some
tests, and then unstack. This is extremely useful for CI environments
when a test slave must be reused.

Change-Id: I5cc7a759537cf62781c534890260df440ed6ea7b
'}]
commit_message:
Move location of devstack-gate unstack to post-tempest

Setting DEVSTACK_GATE_UNSTACK currently will cause devstack-gate to
unstack devstack prior to running tempest. This patch moves that logic
into a EXIT trap to ensure it always runs after everything else is done.
So that it works for environments where they need to stack, run some
tests, and then unstack. This is extremely useful for CI environments
when a test slave must be reused.

Change-Id: I5cc7a759537cf62781c534890260df440ed6ea7b

commit_message:
Read ntp.conf as root to avoid permission issues

The ntp.conf on opensuse is 640 root:ntp, so a normal jenkins/stack
user can not read it. With this patch it is possible to retrieve
the ntp server settings.

Change-Id: I2f445359bbcf1730eb1cba23469b5dc0085f575c

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2019-10-16 18:19:26.000000000', 'files': ['functions.sh'], 'message': 'Capture nfs-ganesha logs and conf

If nfs-ganesha is used as an NFS gateway for another filesystem
like CephFS or glusterfs, then its configuration and logs are
critical for debugging service issues.

Capture these logs in the same manner that we capture logs and
configuration for ceph and gluster themselves.

Change-Id: I12875c7b979a60f46185ab33bae8ea4be0f759d9
'}]
commit_message:
Capture nfs-ganesha logs and conf

If nfs-ganesha is used as an NFS gateway for another filesystem
like CephFS or glusterfs, then its configuration and logs are
critical for debugging service issues.

Capture these logs in the same manner that we capture logs and
configuration for ceph and gluster themselves.

Change-Id: I12875c7b979a60f46185ab33bae8ea4be0f759d9

subject: Stop to use the __future__ module.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-06-02 18:11:25.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/plugins/callback/devstack.py'], 'message': "Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Ib43ece995be1e362d9e1a6e1d56ca475f19259a1
"}]
commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Ib43ece995be1e362d9e1a6e1d56ca475f19259a1

commit_message:
Enable support for cinder multi-backend in tempest

Tempest supports cinder multi-backend tests , by default the devstack installs
a single cinder backend .

Adding two LVM type cinder backends for gate tests:
CINDER_ENABLED_BACKENDS=lvm:lvm_1,lvm:lvm_2

Change-Id: I2ab3b5e717048eb4c617992428b02c851666a941

commit_message:
Adding Permission for stack users to access images

Recently in a grenade job in networking-odl some
tempest tests [1] were failing because of not having
permission to access images. This patch will add
permissions for stack group users to access those
images.

[1]. http://logs.openstack.org/43/425843/2/check/gate-grenade-dsvm-networking-odl-nv/51dfb82/testr_results.html.gz

subject: Removing 'horizon' from Ironic feature matrix
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-11 13:19:03.000000000', 'files': ['features.yaml'], 'message': "Removing 'horizon' from Ironic feature matrix

Having horizon on the feature matrix of Ironic is not useful wrt feature
testing and increases the surface of failure since bugs introduced in
Horizon may make Ironic gate fail. This patch removes horizon from
devstack-gate's feature matrix, disabling it for all Ironic tests using
devstack-gate.

Change-Id: Ifdab1ade451b4d2543a520e38e54099f78cf8b26
"}]
commit_message:
Removing 'horizon' from Ironic feature matrix

Having horizon on the feature matrix of Ironic is not useful wrt feature
testing and increases the surface of failure since bugs introduced in
Horizon may make Ironic gate fail. This patch removes horizon from
devstack-gate's feature matrix, disabling it for all Ironic tests using
devstack-gate.

Change-Id: Ifdab1ade451b4d2543a520e38e54099f78cf8b26

commit_message:
Drop python35 jobs

OpenDev is attempting to cleanup Xenial nodes and Xenial nodes are used
for python35 jobs. The impact to this on devstack-gate should be minimal
as OpenStack is no longer relying on this test harness and we can/should
probably retire it entirely.

Change-Id: I736bf5ca0f41079f5bf1735cb34db1f3884f1766

commit_message:
Add support for l3vpn with NB driver

Creates VRF/VXLAN per VNI, exposed through FRR with kernel routes
Vlan interfaces are added to the appropriate VNI, configured per bgpvpn
config options on the logical switch.

Related-bug: #2051105
Change-Id: I097c4629922d787827aba7761164f4004ed1305a
(cherry picked from commit b3ca890f471fc2694342edc1f22670913cece934)

commit_message:
Add support for l3vpn with NB driver

Creates VRF/VXLAN per VNI, exposed through FRR with kernel routes
Vlan interfaces are added to the appropriate VNI, configured per bgpvpn
config options on the logical switch.

Related-bug: #2051105
Change-Id: I097c4629922d787827aba7761164f4004ed1305a
(cherry picked from commit b3ca890f471fc2694342edc1f22670913cece934)

subject: Return DELETED status when deleting a nonexistent member
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-05-20 10:49:21.000000000', 'files': ['ovn_octavia_provider/helper.py', 'ovn_octavia_provider/tests/unit/test_helper.py'], 'message': "Return DELETED status when deleting a nonexistent member

This patch changes the provisioning_status returned to octavia-api
for the deletion operation of a member that doesn't exist associated
with a pool. Instead of returning ERROR for not having located it,
we will return DELETED to sync OVN DB with  Octavia DB. This way,
the user won't be able to perform unnecessary UPDATE/DELETE
operations on this member in the future.

Closes-Bug: #2065566
Change-Id: Id355fcb0ad5b66bf646be2e4ccbdacf1b40c1d7c
(cherry picked from commit aeac73a0663650efcab96828452753e2db42a7b1)
"}]
commit_message:
Return DELETED status when deleting a nonexistent member

This patch changes the provisioning_status returned to octavia-api
for the deletion operation of a member that doesn't exist associated
with a pool. Instead of returning ERROR for not having located it,
we will return DELETED to sync OVN DB with  Octavia DB. This way,
the user won't be able to perform unnecessary UPDATE/DELETE
operations on this member in the future.

Closes-Bug: #2065566
Change-Id: Id355fcb0ad5b66bf646be2e4ccbdacf1b40c1d7c
(cherry picked from commit aeac73a0663650efcab96828452753e2db42a7b1)

subject: FIX OVN LB Health Monitor checks for IPv6 members
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2024-05-17 16:16:48.000000000', 'files': ['ovn_octavia_provider/tests/unit/test_maintenance.py', 'ovn_octavia_provider/ovsdb/impl_idl_ovn.py', 'ovn_octavia_provider/maintenance.py', 'ovn_octavia_provider/tests/unit/fakes.py', 'ovn_octavia_provider/tests/unit/test_helper.py'], 'message': 'FIX OVN LB Health Monitor checks for IPv6 members

After [1] the IPv6 backend members health checks are supported,
they are mapping into field ip_port_mappings of the OVN LB entity
and translated to OVN SB DB Service_Monitor entries, same way
for IPv4 ones.

However, IPv6 backend members require being enclosed in [ ], and
this was not occurring, causing it not to translate into entries
in the Service_Monitor table. This patch fixes this issue.

Furthermore, a one-time maintenance task has been developed to fix
those existing IPv6 Health Monitors directly upon the startup of
the ovn-octavia-provider component without requiring any action
by the administrator/user.

[1] https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn/commit/40a686e8e70f4141464f7fe2c949ea5b9bf29060

Closes-Bug: #2055876
Change-Id: I9b97aa9e6c8d601bc9e465e6aa8895dcc2666568
(cherry picked from commit bd1137ad57b6e336800d701d6d52733abf968aa5)
'}]
commit_message:
FIX OVN LB Health Monitor checks for IPv6 members

After [1] the IPv6 backend members health checks are supported,
they are mapping into field ip_port_mappings of the OVN LB entity
and translated to OVN SB DB Service_Monitor entries, same way
for IPv4 ones.

However, IPv6 backend members require being enclosed in [ ], and
this was not occurring, causing it not to translate into entries
in the Service_Monitor table. This patch fixes this issue.

Furthermore, a one-time maintenance task has been developed to fix
those existing IPv6 Health Monitors directly upon the startup of
the ovn-octavia-provider component without requiring any action
by the administrator/user.

[1] https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn/commit/40a686e8e70f4141464f7fe2c949ea5b9bf29060

Closes-Bug: #2055876
Change-Id: I9b97aa9e6c8d601bc9e465e6aa8895dcc2666568
(cherry picked from commit bd1137ad57b6e336800d701d6d52733abf968aa5)

commit_message:
FIX OVN LB Health Monitor checks for IPv6 members

After [1] the IPv6 backend members health checks are supported,
they are mapping into field ip_port_mappings of the OVN LB entity
and translated to OVN SB DB Service_Monitor entries, same way
for IPv4 ones.

However, IPv6 backend members require being enclosed in [ ], and
this was not occurring, causing it not to translate into entries
in the Service_Monitor table. This patch fixes this issue.

Furthermore, a one-time maintenance task has been developed to fix
those existing IPv6 Health Monitors directly upon the startup of
the ovn-octavia-provider component without requiring any action
by the administrator/user.

[1] https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn/commit/40a686e8e70f4141464f7fe2c949ea5b9bf29060

Closes-Bug: #2055876
Change-Id: I9b97aa9e6c8d601bc9e465e6aa8895dcc2666568
(cherry picked from commit bd1137ad57b6e336800d701d6d52733abf968aa5)

subject: [tempest] Tag zed-last
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2024-05-21 16:56:56.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/zed/tempest.yaml', 'deliverables/dalmatian/tempest.yaml'], 'message': "[tempest] Tag zed-last

Yoga branch is moving to unmaintained state now[1]. Tempest and
tempest plugins are branchless which means master version of
Tempest and its plugins is used to test the supported stable
branches.

Once any stable branch is moved to unmaintained state then,
Tempest and its plugins compatible tag[2] needs to be
released so that we can keep testing the unmaintained stable branches
with that tag once master Tempest and its plugins are not compatible[3].

Tagging 'zed-last' with the same hash of new tag 39.0.0 which mark
the end of support for stable/zed in Tempest.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22zed-unmaintained%22
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html
[3] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html

Change-Id: I8a748123627d9fea17ec1669f1f7ec5353572a2b
"}]
commit_message:
[tempest] Tag zed-last

Yoga branch is moving to unmaintained state now[1]. Tempest and
tempest plugins are branchless which means master version of
Tempest and its plugins is used to test the supported stable
branches.

Once any stable branch is moved to unmaintained state then,
Tempest and its plugins compatible tag[2] needs to be
released so that we can keep testing the unmaintained stable branches
with that tag once master Tempest and its plugins are not compatible[3].

Tagging 'zed-last' with the same hash of new tag 39.0.0 which mark
the end of support for stable/zed in Tempest.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22zed-unmaintained%22
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html
[3] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html

Change-Id: I8a748123627d9fea17ec1669f1f7ec5353572a2b

commit_message:
Additional test state fixes

In running some tests downstream, in this case where someone had
aggressively asserted default interface values, some additional
tests failed, and in fun ways.

This changes a couple tests so they explicitly set and account
for differeing defaults from upstream CI. Also adds an inline note
on the Boot from Volume test which can fail if the volume creation
fails.

Change-Id: Ieaa7ac9d9058ba40955248699e8fd762d4b3c15d

subject: Patch to enforce json extension works in existing API behaviour
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 10342, 'name': 'Jay Faulkner', 'display_name': 'JayF', 'email': 'jay@jvf.cc', 'username': 'JayF'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 17, 'created': '2024-05-12 05:19:48.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_tempest_plugin/tests/api/admin/test_nodes.py', 'ironic_tempest_plugin/tests/api/admin/test_portgroups.py', 'ironic_tempest_plugin/tests/api/admin/test_allocations.py', 'ironic_tempest_plugin/tests/api/admin/test_deploy_templates.py'], 'message': 'Patch to enforce json extension works in existing API behaviour

Currently, .json extensions are stripped out during the search or while
taking any action on a node through its name or uuid.

This pecan feature ensures that a reference to
``0178-0c2c-9c26-ca69-3011-a9dd.json`` is treated
as ``0178-0c2c-9c26-ca69-3011-a9dd``

If we had two nodes that differ by a .json extension in either of the
names, ``"node", "node.json"``, and we intend for the latter, we’ll
need to append an additional ".json" extension in the reference query,
else the node without the extension is treated as the default node,
and the extension node is only considered if it’s the only node with
the name.

Same workaround if we wanted our ``0178-0c2c-9c26-ca69-3011-a9dd.json``
correctly targeted, we append an additonal ".json" extension to our
query.

This patch tries to validate this behavior in API versions prior to
1.91, where this feature exists.

Change-Id: I613e596e8cf52f36b9c7caac30bdb3ff0d3bf821
'}]
commit_message:
Patch to enforce json extension works in existing API behaviour

Currently, .json extensions are stripped out during the search or while
taking any action on a node through its name or uuid.

This pecan feature ensures that a reference to
``0178-0c2c-9c26-ca69-3011-a9dd.json`` is treated
as ``0178-0c2c-9c26-ca69-3011-a9dd``

If we had two nodes that differ by a .json extension in either of the
names, ``"node", "node.json"``, and we intend for the latter, we’ll
need to append an additional ".json" extension in the reference query,
else the node without the extension is treated as the default node,
and the extension node is only considered if it’s the only node with
the name.

Same workaround if we wanted our ``0178-0c2c-9c26-ca69-3011-a9dd.json``
correctly targeted, we append an additonal ".json" extension to our
query.

This patch tries to validate this behavior in API versions prior to
1.91, where this feature exists.

Change-Id: I613e596e8cf52f36b9c7caac30bdb3ff0d3bf821

subject: Silence warning when running in a container with overlayfs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-05-22 13:07:04.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/fix-host-uuid-warning-3814b7e47bde8010.yaml', 'os_brick/tests/initiator/connectors/test_nvmeof.py', 'os_brick/initiator/connectors/nvmeof.py'], 'message': "Silence warning when running in a container with overlayfs

When running in a container using overlayfs we may see the following
warning:

  WARNING os_brick.initiator.connectors.nvmeof process execution error
  in _get_host_uuid: Unexpected error while running command.
  Command: blkid overlay -s UUID -o value
  Exit code: 2
  Stdout: ''
  Stderr: '': oslo_concurrency.processutils.ProcessExecutionError:
  Unexpected error while running command.

This change fixes the issue by not running the command when the file
system source is overlay.

Closes-Bug: #2045557
Change-Id: I3abc5bee7f474a9a40d396c559a42edff86334e0
(cherry picked from commit bd07c571da7a3f78dbdec68af638b7e16181848d)
(cherry picked from commit 823cda4b8a2102281facfcd666514fc6147d770a)
"}]
commit_message:
Silence warning when running in a container with overlayfs

When running in a container using overlayfs we may see the following
warning:

  WARNING os_brick.initiator.connectors.nvmeof process execution error
  in _get_host_uuid: Unexpected error while running command.
  Command: blkid overlay -s UUID -o value
  Exit code: 2
  Stdout: ''
  Stderr: '': oslo_concurrency.processutils.ProcessExecutionError:
  Unexpected error while running command.

This change fixes the issue by not running the command when the file
system source is overlay.

Closes-Bug: #2045557
Change-Id: I3abc5bee7f474a9a40d396c559a42edff86334e0
(cherry picked from commit bd07c571da7a3f78dbdec68af638b7e16181848d)
(cherry picked from commit 823cda4b8a2102281facfcd666514fc6147d770a)

commit_message:
Clean up unused labels from nl02 config

The provider-specific label variants designating nested virt
acceleration support or larger flavors are unused by nl02, so delete
them to reduce confusion.

Change-Id: Id3ac994216624e32d83ae9066d3e77f713cc7245

commit_message:
Remote Ceph with cephadm

Add podman ceph-common and jq as part of preinstall dependency.
Add REMOTE_CEPH capabilities to CEPHADM deployment.
Removed set_min_client only if cinder is enabled, this should be set
in any case.
Get FSID from ceph.conf in /etc/ceph to avoid unnecessary override.

Part of an effort to test multinode deployments with cephadm.

Needed-By: I5162815b66d3f3e8cf8c1e246b61b0ea06c1a270
Change-Id: I84249ae268dfe00a112c67e5170b679acb318a25
(cherry picked from commit b663a9fb838ae6632a3b7e30ee3b4a36a88454f5)

commit_message:
swift backup driver: Ignore 404 during object deletion

Swift may return 404 to object deletion even though the object is (or
will be) actually removed, and 404 can be treated as success.

Closes-Bug: #2061988
Change-Id: I3a60cb5951b072d2c184fe1bc6dbc765cd46642a

commit_message:
Call evaluate_hardware_support exactly once per hwm

Fixes an issue where we could call evaluate_hardware_support multiple
times each run. Now, instead, we cache the values and use the cache
where needed.

Adds unit test coverage for get_managers and the new method.
Fixes issue where we were caching hardware managers between unit tests.

Closes-bug: 2066308
Change-Id: Iebc5b6d2440bfc9f23daa322493379bbe69e84d0
(cherry picked from commit c39517b04479df1aeaf96402840238236870fa74)

subject: tests: Use `del_fake_chassis` when deleting a chassis
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2024-05-22 05:40:01.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/test_mech_driver.py'], 'message': 'tests: Use `del_fake_chassis` when deleting a chassis

This will guarantee that regardless of ovsdbapp version, Chassis_Private
will be deleted. This allows us to wait for a single event (DELETE) and
test the same behavior for all ovsdbapp versions. (Behavior of agent
listing when both Chassis and Chassis_Private records are deleted from
ovn db.)

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/920062
Change-Id: I0dfa21a927067afb532d7632f7e05427623327f5
'}]
commit_message:
tests: Use `del_fake_chassis` when deleting a chassis

This will guarantee that regardless of ovsdbapp version, Chassis_Private
will be deleted. This allows us to wait for a single event (DELETE) and
test the same behavior for all ovsdbapp versions. (Behavior of agent
listing when both Chassis and Chassis_Private records are deleted from
ovn db.)

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/920062
Change-Id: I0dfa21a927067afb532d7632f7e05427623327f5
